# **Projects and Requirements for Triveni, The School Exhibition**

##                                                  **Classes VI-XII**

## **1\. Department of English:** 

    Teacher:Ms. Rumi Bora  
1\. Å platform for the performers to stand and perform slam poetry.   
2\. Chairs to be laid   
3\. A spinner to be prepared ( cardboard, a stand. Paint, markers) Rs 1500 approx.   
4\. A speaker (microphone)

    All the other items are available in school.

    Teacher: Mr. Debapratim Bharali

1\. three plywood board to make museum of louvre   
2.chart paper   
3.drawing colour   
4\. ingredients  for making simple french  food.

## **3\. Department of Hindi:**

    Teacher:Ms. Geetanjali Goswami

    हिंदी/संस्कृत कक्ष का नाम \- हिंदी है हम वतन है हिंदोस्ता हमारा/भारतस्य प्रतिष्ठे द्वे

1\. सरस्वती वंदना एवं गीता स्तोत्र

2\. हिंदी भाषा पर भाषण

3\. छात्रों के द्वारा लिखे सुलेख प्रदर्शन 

4\. हिंदी क्वीज

5\. कविता पाठ /हास्य-व्यंग्य प्रस्तुति

6.ऐतिहासिक पात्रों एकल अभिनय  

7\. मुहावरे और लोकोक्तियाँ का प्रदर्शन 

8\. कवियों का सचित्र परिचय  

9\. लिपि का विकास जैसे – ब्राह्मी, खरोष्ठी, देवनागरी, प्राचीन, नवीन – वर्णन लिखेंगे 

    10\. हिंदी की विविध बोलियाँ पर स्पीच

11\. विभिन्न भाषाओं का वर्णमाला चार्ट 

12\. संस्कृत सुभाषित एवं विभिन्न संस्थाओं द्वारा प्रयुक्त विशेष संस्कृत पंक्तियां।

13.नुक्कड़ नाटक

14.तुलसीदास या मीरा के गीत का प्रदर्शन 

     15\. रॉयल ग्लोबल कविता रचना

## **6\. Department of Science(9-12):**

    Teacher:Dr. Utpal Saha

1\. Pedal Power – Bicycle Generator Concept  
Good-quality cycle stand or frame: ₹500  
DC generator (10–12V): ₹300  
Rechargeable battery: ₹200  
LED strip/USB output port: ₹150  
Voltmeter (optional): ₹200  
Wires, switches, connectors, mount base: ₹150  
\*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹1300

2\. Newton’s Cradle (Improved Display Version)  
Stainless steel/metal balls (5–7): ₹250  
Acrylic or wooden frame: ₹200  
Nylon string, polished base, decorative finish: ₹100  
     \*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹550

3\. Wind Turbine Generator (Functional Model)  
DC motor with high torque: ₹250  
3D-printed/plastic fan blades: ₹100  
Strong base and tower (PVC or wood): ₹150  
Rechargeable battery or LED output: ₹100  
Multimeter (optional): ₹250  
\*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹850

4\. Application of Piezoelectricity (with Multiple Sensors)  
6–8 Piezo discs: ₹150  
LED panel or buzzer: ₹100  
Acrylic/foam padding base: ₹100  
Display card with pressure indicators: ₹100  
    \*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹450	

5\. Mars Exploration and Colonization (Diorama with Lights)  
Thermocol/craft board base: ₹100  
Acrylic dome/clay habitats: ₹150  
Toy rover/robot arm mock-up: ₹200  
Decorative red sand, solar panels, LEDs: ₹150  
\*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹600

6\. International Space Station (Realistic Model)  
PVC tubes/syringes for modules: ₹100  
Solar panels (mirror sheet/LED): ₹100  
Printed labelling, colored detailing: ₹100  
Transparent stand/acrylic cover (optional): ₹150  
      \*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹450

7\. Artificial Photosynthesis (Working Setup)  
Solar cell (3V–6V): ₹200  
Electrodes (graphite rods, etc.): ₹100  
Glassware setup (beakers/test tubes): ₹100  
Hydrogen/Oxygen test setup (bubble collector): ₹100  
\*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹500

8\. Magnetic Train (Functional Demo Model)  
Powerful neodymium magnets: ₹200  
Magnetic levitation base (foam \+ rails): ₹150  
Toy train frame \+ wheels: ₹150  
Acrylic cover for display (optional): ₹150  
      \*\*Estimated Cost:\*\* ₹650

Total Enhanced Budget Summary

## **7\. Department of Social science (For classes 9&10):**

Theme: Ahom Dynasty

| Subject |   | Materials Required | Estimated Budget |
| :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- |
| HISTORY | History and Culture of: Ahom Dynasty: Models/ Structures on Charaideo Rang Ghar Kareng Ghar Saraighat Bridge | Thermocol Sheets Acrylic colors/ Poster colors Markers, Sketch pens Glue stick, Double sided tapes Plyboards Fevicol, Fevistick Standees | Rupees 7000 to 9000/ |
| GEOGRAPHY | The Geographical extent of the Ahom Dynasty will be depicted with their resource base. Maps on flex, few thermocol structures/ models, traditional attire, festivals, cuisine, etc. will be highlighted. | Maps on flex Thermocol Sheets Acrylic colors/ Poster colors Markers, Sketch pens Glue stick, Double sided tapes Plyboards Fevicol, Fevistick Standees | A bpudget of 8000/   |
| POL. SC. | The Ahom administrative model |   | Cost: Approximately Rupees 1500/ |
|   |  | Total Expenses | Rupees 18,500/ |

**For classes 6-8**

Exhibit Layout in the Room- Focus- INDIA  
1\.     Entrance Wall  
o   Timeline 1: “Echoes of Time – Earth’s Formation” on a large plyboard.  
2\.     Right Wall Panels  
o   Timeline 2: “Unearthing the Past – Evolution & Early Humans- One Model”.  
o   Timeline 3: “Stone by Stone – Tools & Habitation- Two Models”.  
o   Use bordering cut-outs of fossils, stone artifacts around panels.

3\.     Left Wall or Central Stand(s)  
o   Timeline 4: “Earth Then & Now – First Tools stone to Bronze with interactive elements. Three models  
o   Add standee: early human silhouette.  
4\.     Central Floor Area/Table  
o   Fossil corner: Thermocol base, sand spread, small plastic replicas.  
o   Mannequin display (optional) with simple clothing or tool replica.  
5\.     Lighting  
o   LED strip along ceiling highlight path.

Execution Tips-

●       Use thermocol panels for 3D visuals like a volcano or earth layers.  
●       Colour-code timelines: e.g., blues for geological time, earthy tones for humans.  
●       Include info graphics visualizing time spans, tool evolution.  
●       Use decorative borders (leafy or cave-paint style) for thematic framing.  
●   	Mix text \+ images \+ props to cater to different learner types.

Here’s a detailed plan and probable cost estimate for the exhibition featuring our four timelines

**Table: Material & Cost Estimate**

| Item | Unit | Qty | Price/Unit (₹) | Total Cost (₹) |
| ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- |
| Thermocol Sheets (3 ft × 2 ft) | Sheet | 10 | 70 | 700 |
| Plyboard Panels (4 × 3 ft) | Panel | 8 | 500 | 4,000 |
| Acrylic/Water Poster Colours | Set | 4 | 250 | 1,000 |
| Sketch Pens & Markers | Box | 4 | 150 | 600 |
| Glue (Fevicol / Fevistick) | Tub/Stick | 4 | 80 | 320 |
| Double-Sided Tape | Roll | 4 | 60 | 240 |
| Decorative Borders / Cut-outs | Set | 4 | 150 | 600 |
| LED Strip (5 m) | Roll | 1 | 600 | 600 |
| Standees / Cut-outs | Full-body print | 4 | 800 | 3,200 |
|  |  |   |   | 11,260 |

## 

**GRADES 11 & 12** 

**Theme: PARTITION OF INDIA** 

| SUBJECT  | CONCEPT  | MATERIALS   REQUIRED | ESTIMATED   BUDGET |
| ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- |
| Geographical  Aspect Of   Partition Of   India | **1947 India Partition Display Focus:** Geographical, demographic, and political changes. **Map 1 (Pre-Partition):** Highlights provinces (Punjab, Bengal, Sindh). **Map 2 (Post-Partition):** Shows India, West Pakistan, East Pakistan. **Map 3 (Refugee Migration):** Illustrates routes, camps, affected cities (Delhi, Lahore, Calcutta). **Map 4 (Communal Violence):** Pinpoints hotspots (Lahore, Amritsar, Noakhali).  | Maps on flex  Cardboard  Thermocol Sheets  Acrylic colors/ Poster  colors  Markers, Sketch pens Glue stick, Double  sided tapes  Plyboards  Fevicol, Fevistick  Standees  Wires  Flags  Photos/ Postcards  Clips | Rupees 8000/ |
| Political Science  | In a map of British India  show the princely states  and how they were   integrated into India.  Hyderabad, Jammu snd  Kashmir, Travancore,  Junagadh will be shown  and explained by the  students  Migration & Refugee Movement  Miniature moving train  model (battery/motor operated)  People carrying bundles  (symbolizing migration)  Refugee camps and  long queues  Add sound effects or QR  code to play a refugee  story/audio  Smart panel can be   used  Label: "14 million   displaced, the largest  human migration" | Maps on clay  Cardboard  Thermocol Sheets   Acrylic colors/ Poster  colors  Markers, Sketch pens Glue stick, Double   sided tapes  Plyboards  Fevicol, FevistickStandees  Wires  Flags  Photos/ Postcards   Clips | Rupees 8000 |

| HISTORY  | Old news papers to be  either printed/ flex  Books related to   partition and its   historiography  Showcasing of few   partition horror history Book stall  | Chart paper  Books  Colours  A3 sheets  Glue  Photographs of   partition museums | Rupees 6000  |
| :---- | :---- | :---- | :---- |
| SOCIOLOGY  | Ppt displaying the   sociological aspect of  partition touching topics  on communal violence,  displacement, identity  formation and nation  building along with   social stratification and  inequality |  | Rupees 1500 |
| PSYCHOLOGY  | Psychology of Partition: Displacement & Trauma An interactive, experiential, or visual model focusing on the psychological impact of Partition. Themes: Psychological Zones: Displays covering Pre-Partition Anxiety (fear, rumors), During Partition Trauma (violence, loss, separation), and Post-Partition Memory & Identity Reconstruction (PTSD, nostalgia, generational trauma). Will include quotes and survivor accounts. Mind Map of Trauma: An interactive diagram illustrating how trauma affects the brain (Fight/Flight/Freeze, PTSD symptoms, survivor's guilt). Concepts: Trauma & PTSD, Cognitive Dissonance, Defense Mechanisms, Identity & Memory, Collective vs. Personal Memory, Intergenerational Transmission of Trauma. | Type of Model:  Interactive installation  with visual aids \+   audio \+ psychological  analysis | Rupees 1500 |

## **9\. Department of Department of Commerce:**

Teacher: BalaMeenakshi Rajkhowa

Proposed Stalls & Highlights

1. Rent the Trend – Sustainable Fashion  
   * Concept: Promote sustainable fashion through rental of curated ethnic and western wear.  
   * Highlights: Mannequin displays, mirror booth, QR-linked catalog, “Reels Station”  
   * Engagement: Outfit rental for selfies using tokens worth ₹50–₹100  
   * Contest: “Best Styled Visitor” – featured on school’s social media  
2. Plastic Bank – Recycle for Rewards  
   * Concept: Exchange plastic waste for eco-friendly rewards  
   * Giveaways: Seed pens, recycled bookmarks, healthy snacks  
   * Add-ons: “Plastic Footprint” calculator, live waste counter, awareness displays  
3. Stock Market Simulator  
   * Concept: Visitors invest mock money in listed companies using real or simulated data  
   * Tools: Play money wallets, stock tracker sheets, market screen  
   * Engagement: Bull vs Bear quiz, “Investor of the Day” award  
4. Bake & Earn – Sweet Entrepreneurship  
   * Items for Sale:  
     * Cupcakes – ₹50  
     * Cookies (2 pcs) – ₹50  
     * Lemonade (eco-cup) – ₹50  
   * Add-on: “Build Your Cupcake” – decorate your own for ₹100 (30 slots only)  
   * Skills Applied: Budgeting, pricing, inventory, promotion  
5. The Price is Right – Consumer Game Booth  
   * Activity: Guess the price of everyday branded goods (Maggi, Dove, etc.)  
   * Rewards: Small prizes for correct answers  
   * Purpose: Develop price awareness and decision-making  
6. Flashcard & Brand Mania Zone  
   * Activities: Identify the logo, match the slogan, business buzzwords  
   * Engagement: Fast-paced quiz rounds with instant prizes  
   * Purpose: Brand familiarity and business vocabulary

Educational Commerce Models

Placed strategically near stalls to enhance concept clarity:

* Supply Chain Model – Raw material to consumer flow using real packaging  
* Stock Market Trend Model – Bull/Bear visuals, stock tickers, company graphs  
* From Waste to Wealth – Tiered model showing transformation of plastic waste  
* Circular Economy Cycle – Explains how reuse & recycling benefit business and planet  
* Marketing Mix (4Ps/7Ps) – Illustrated using real product examples  
* E-Commerce Flow – Order to delivery chain on platforms like Amazon and Flipkart

Budget Summary (INR)

| Item | Estimated Cost (INR) |
| :---- | :---- |
| Fashion Stall Setup (Mannequins, Mirror, Decor) | 3,000 |
| Printing & Branding (QR Catalogs, Posters, Banners) | 1,200 |
| Eco Giveaways (Seed Pens, Bookmarks, Snacks) | 2,000 |
| Bakery & Beverage Supplies (60–70 servings) | 2,200 |
| Flashcards, Game Materials, Quiz Props | 1,500 |
| Props for Consumer Game (Products, Labels) | 800 |
| Stock Market Setup (Play Money, Charts, Prizes) | 1,500 |
| Models (Commerce Concepts, Charts, Base Materials) | 1,800 |
| Certificates, Prize Hampers & Token Gifts | 1,000 |
| Miscellaneous (Stationery, Tape, Markers, Tools) | 1,000 |
| Total Estimated Cost | ₹15,000 |
